description: Point cloud resampling involves adjusting the density and distribution of points in a point cloud dataset. This is crucial for applications in computer-aided engineering (CAE) where preserving the underlying geometry and topology is essential.
you_have_this_if: You have a point cloud dataset that is too dense or sparse for your application.
You need to maintain the geometric features of the original data.
You are facing performance issues due to the size of the point cloud.
You require a solution that does not depend on pre-trained models.
You are working with CAE applications that demand high fidelity in point representation.

approaches.best_for: when you need to resample point clouds for CAE applications while preserving geometry and topology.
approaches.key_tradeoff: SOLT provides a lightweight solution but may require careful parameter tuning to achieve optimal results.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to resample point clouds while ensuring that the geometric features are preserved without heavy computational overhead.

start_here: Start with the Series of Local Triangulations (SOLT) technique, as it effectively balances performance and fidelity in point cloud resampling for CAE applications.
